author.bio: Dr. Chiang is a relief veterinarian, web developer, and entrepreneur who believes that the mental wellbeing crisis within the veterinary industry can be drastically improved through exploration and collaboration. In his free time, he is a fitness enthusiast who also enjoys traveling and trying out new food. Oh, he is also a corgi fanatic!
author.name: Andy Chiang, DVM

post.title: DVM Balloons Ep. 2 – New Year Champagne Cupcakes with Dr. Geena Ng
post.excerpt: Dr. Ng celebrates the New Year in style by baking her signature champagne cupcake! In this episode, she talks about how baking helps her through the ups and downs of being a veterinarian.

children.text: Do you have a personal space you go to when challenges arise?

Dr. Geena Ng joined Andy to talk about her passion in baking and made a batch of Champagne cupcakes just in time to celebrate 2019. Dr. Ng is a new grad and currently doing a veterinary internship. As most veterinarians know, internships are not only physically demanding, but also mentally draining. Because of that, Dr. Ng turns to baking regularly to stay balanced.

Dr. Ng describes baking as a safe place where she can comfortably expand her creativity and work her magic on just a few simple ingredients. As a new grad at a fast paced hospital, baking also boosts her confidence on the ER floor as it reminds her to go back to the basics and apply her personal touch to every case. Her approach to baking highlights the importance of having a familiar, comfortable, and safe space that a person a consistently rely on; that space becomes especially important when challenges arise in life.
On a side note, how stinkin’ adorable is Teddy? And how awesome are those bite tags on Dr. Ng’s cabinets?
I hope you enjoy this video. If you have a personal space that you turn to, please share with us!
